meanings.definition: One who brings happiness or good fortune.
meanings.sent1: The felicitator at the party made everyone smile with their jokes.
meanings.sent2: The felicitator in the story always helped others in need.
meanings.sent3: The felicitator brought so much joy that even the grumpy cat couldn't resist purring.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a felicitator, spreading happiness wherever it went.
meanings.sent5: The old man was known as the town's felicitator, always bringing cheer to those around him.

meanings.definition: To bring happiness or good fortune to someone.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to felicitator her friend by throwing a surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The kind words from the stranger felicitatored her during a tough time.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick to felicitator the audience involved pulling a rabbit out of a hat.
meanings.sent4: The sun's warm rays seemed to felicitator the flowers into full bloom.
meanings.sent5: His positive attitude never failed to felicitator those around him, turning frowns into smiles.
